records.description: Panel, possibly from a cope orphrey, depicting the Virgin or a nun saint wearing a crown of thorns and holding a representation of the Sacred Heart, with a strapwork frame. The techniques used are appliquÃ©, "or nuÃ©", and embroidery using split, whip and satin stitches. On plain weave linen support and a second support of green cut silk velvet.
records.title: Panel from a Cope Orphrey
records.provenance: Harry G. Friedman, New York, Gift to Fogg Museum, 1960.
records.department: Department of Paintings, Sculpture & Decorative Arts

records.creditline: Harvard Art Museums/Fogg Museum, Gift of Harry G. Friedman
records.verificationleveldescription: Best. Object is extensively researched, well described and information is vetted

images.copyright: President and Fellows of Harvard College

records.description: Textile fragment, part of an orphrey panel, depicting the Holy Family with Angels, with the ox and ass, the bricks of the stable and a star above. The piece has a red silk satin ground with polychromed yarns in lampas technique (compound weave) using a white binding warp.
records.title: Florentine Border depicting the Holy Family with Angels
records.provenance: Harry G. Friedman, New York, Gift to Fogg Museum, 1960.
records.department: Department of Paintings, Sculpture & Decorative Arts

records.creditline: Harvard Art Museums/Fogg Museum, Bequest of Lucy Wallace Porter

records.description: Point composition of stylized poppies, tulips, carnations and other small flowers  and foliage in shades of salmon, green and purple on ivory-coloured ribbon silk ground; pieced horizontally and vertically; backed in linen plain weave with applied border of woven yellow silk braid
records.title: Fragment of Brocade
records.provenance: Lucy Wallace Porter, bequest; to Fogg Art Museum, 1962

records.description: Textile fragment known as a "Florentine border", from an orphrey panel, depicting the Virgin adoring the Child flanked by two angels with a red satin ground and silk lampas using supplementary gilt metallic yarns.  Above are the words from the Gospel according to St. John:1, "[VE]RBVM HARO FATVM EST" (The Word is made flesh)
records.title: Florentine Border depicting the Virgin Adoring the Child with Angels
records.provenance: Harry G. Friedman, New York, Gift to Fogg Museum, 1960.
records.department: Department of Paintings, Sculpture & Decorative Arts

records.description: Towel with two selvedges of linen plain weave with wide stipe of diaper (bird's eye twill) incorporating "woad" (indigo-dyed cotton).  Repeat pattern of dragons affronted.

records.title: Perugian towel

records.description: Panel (comprised of two panels stitched together) of  "Genoa" velvet, or polychromed ciselÃ© cut and uncut velvet, in "point composition" (symmetrical around a central axis) depicting large branching floral and foliate arabesques.   Ground weave of cream-coloured satin with silk cut and uncut velvet pile in crimson, green, yellow, cream and peach.
records.title: Panel of Genoa Velvet
records.provenance: Grenville Lindall Winthrop, New York, bequest; to Fogg Art Museum, 1943
records.department: Department of Paintings, Sculpture & Decorative Arts
